frontmatter.title: Cloud Native Enablement
frontmatter.description: IBM Cloud-Native Enablement self paced agenda

internal.content: --- title: Cloud Native Enablement description: IBM Cloud-Native Enablement self paced agenda --- Goal Introduction RedHat OpenShift Fundamentals Application Modernization IBM Cloud Pak for Applications IBM Cloud Pak for Integration # Welcome ! The GSI Cloud Native Enablement is self-paced learning journey that has been crafted to enable partner teams to get up to speed with learning how to build solutions with IBM Cloud,Red Hat OpenShift and IBM Cloud Paks. Each section of learning includes mutliple hours of hands-on enablement activities. These are performed inside a fully enabled IBM Cloud Account containing all the Cloud Services you need to achieve success. In order to complete the enablement activities, you must have access received an **IBM GSI Sandbox** invite email. A **IBM GSI Sandbox** includes a full managed instance of OpenShift and the corresponding **IBM Cloud Paks**, the cluster is also enabled with the accelerator asset from the [**IBM Garage for Cloud**](https://ibm-garage-cloud.github.io/ibm-garage-developer-guide/). The asset rapidly increases your time to success when developing cloud native application with IBM Cloud and RedHat OpenShift. ## Goal > Ensure that GSI Ecosystem Partners are fully enabled > to support their client engagements and co-creating > solutions based on Red Hat OpenShift and IBM Cloud Paks > that run on the IBM Cloud. > IBM GSI Ecosystem Team How we will get there: - Recordings from IBM Cloud SME - Digital self-paced enablement to support your learning - Slack channels for SME support, knowledge sharing and networking Use the following Agenda to guide you through the self paced material. ## Introduction The introduction section has been designed to help you understand the key concepts of what building for Cloud Native means. If you have limited knowledge of this area it is highly recommended that you complete this section in full before moving onto using the **IBM GSI Sandbox** enablement for real application development tasks. | **Preparation** | **Duration** | **Presenter** | **Link** | |------------------------------------------------------- |---------- |------------------ |--------------------------------------------- | | IBM Cloud Strategy, Chapter 2 offerings and use cases | 1hr | Roland Barcia, Distinguished Engineer | Recording Presentation | | What is Cloud Native (Presentation) | 30mins | Seismic | Presentation | | Understand Cloud Native Concepts | 30mins | Reading | [Concepts](/concepts/cloud-native-overview) | | Self Paced Pre Learning to get you ready | 3-5hr | Reading | [Pre Learning](/activation/overview) | ## RedHat OpenShift Fundamentals GSI teams need consistent execution, proven delivery and assets and support a wide range of use cases to enable project teams to accelerate their delivery. The fundamental learning path is understanding how to build RedHat OpenShift applications and manage them with DevOps. The IBM Garage for Cloud team has created a number of of open source assets that can be used to enable. The learning path will give you a good grounding in the core fundamentals of cloud native application development on IBM Cloud with RedHat OpenShift. **Desired outcomes:** - Understand how to approach Cloud Native Development with IBM Kubernetes and Red Hat OpenShift - Use Day 1 developer experience to create your first OpenShift app that is managed with a CI Pipeline - Build a 3 tier microservice application that is fully deployed with Jenkins/CI and Argo/CD - Understand how Day 2 developer experience is managed with Logging, Monitoring, CD deployment - Understand how to Secure you applications end to end - Understand how to do coffee shop development with Code Ready Containers for learning and experimenting on your local laptop _Requirements_: - Some understanding of **Java** and **NodeJS** is required - Some understanding of **Enterprise** class applications - Some understanding of **DevOps** pipelines | Topic | Duration | Presenter | Link | |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |---------- |--------------------------------------------- |--------------------------------- | | Overview Enablement Content | 30mins | | [Reading](/overview/content-overview) | | **Day 1 Developer Experience** Self Paced learning with IBM Cloud and RedHat OpenShift: | 8+hrs | IBM Garage for Cloud Developer Guide | [Tasks](/enablement/tasks-day1) | | **Day 2 Developer Experience** Self Paced learning with IBM Cloud and RedHat OpenShift | 8+hrs | | [Tasks](/enablement/tasks-day2) | ## Application Modernization Clients have a historical backlog of applications that need to be modernized. Using the IBM Cloud Pak for Applications Transformation Advisor it is possible to understand the effort required to move a legacy WebSphere application to IBM RedHat OpenShift. This self paced learning will walk you through the process and tools. **Desired outcomes:** - Use the migration artifacts produced by IBM Cloud Transformation Advisor to migrate A Java application to Liberty on Cloud Pak for Apps on Red Hat OpenShift. - Understand the IBM approach to refactoring applications to microservices | Topic | Duration | Presenter | Link | |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |---------- |-------------------------- |----------------------------------------- | | Introduction to IBM's Application Modernization Approach and Tools | 1hr | Dave Mulley | Video Presentation Presentation | | Application Modernization Journey and Transformation Advisor Methodology | 2hr | Yaro DunchychDave Mulley | Video Presentation | | Use the migration artifacts produced by IBM Cloud Transformation Advisor to migrate A Java application to Liberty on Cloud Pak for Apps on Red Hat OpenShift | 4hrs | | [Tasks](/enablement/tasks-icp4) | ## IBM Cloud Pak for Applications Cloud Pak for Apps supports some new and emerging programming models. Tekton is becoming the default tooling to enable multi cloud DevOps. This learning path will walk you through creating process of building on the new **Tekton** tools. **Desired outcomes:** - Set-up OpenShift Developer Tools: Kabernaro, appsody, Tekton - Create a Tekton pipeline - Build and deploy an app - Customize the Tekton pipeline to include test code coverage - (Architects) Set-up Dev stack governance with Appsody | Topic | Duration | Presenter | Link | |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |---------- |---------------- |----------------------------------------- | | High Level Overview of the Cloud Pak for Applications Developer Tools CP4Apps latest 3.0.0.1 install on OCP 3.11 Kabanero Appsody Tekton | 1hr | Carlos Santana | Video Presentation Presentation | | **ICP4A** Self Paced Learning | 3hrs | | [Tasks](/enablement/tasks-icp4a) | ## IBM Cloud Pak for Integration **Desired outcomes:** - Be able to explain the concepts of Agile Integration to clients - Understand how to use the Cloud Pak for Integration in the modernization journey - Use the Modern Integration reference architecture - Be able to apply the Agile Integration Methodology - Understand and demonstrate the three architecture perspectives for agile integration: Application Integration, API, Messaging & Streams COMING SOON !! Waiting on some important improvements for ICP4I integration with IBM Cloud IAM
